category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 12 (Term of Office of Executives)
contents: Article 12 (Term of office of executives) ① The term of office of executives shall be as follows: 1. Chairman of the board: 3 years, 2. Executive directors, non-executive directors (excluding ex officio directors), and auditors: 2 years, 3. Ex officio directors. : Term of office, ② The term of office of executives under the provisions of paragraph 1 may be reappointed in one-year increments. In this case, the person with the authority to appoint an executive decides whether to reappoint the executive by considering the following categories: 1. Chairman: Results of management performance evaluation in accordance with Article 48 of the Public Institutions Management Act, 2. Executive director: Article 17 Evaluation of performance contract performance and other job performance pursuant to Article 4, 3. Non-executive directors (excluding ex officio directors) and auditors: Evaluation results of performance of performance and other performance of duties pursuant to Article 36 of the Public Institutions Management Act , ③ If an executive under the provisions of paragraph 2 is reappointed, he or she will not be recommended by the Executive Recommendation Committee. , ④ An executive whose term of office has expired will perform his or her duties until a successor is appointed.
